items.sentence: What we don't know is whether Tom can do that or not.
We're not allowed to tell Tom what's going to happen.
Tom, Mary, John and Alice were all wearing name tags.
Tom, Mary, John and Alice are all in there somewhere.
Tom, Mary, John and Alice all ordered the same thing.
Tom would be interested in hearing you sing, I think.
Tom works as a waiter at a restaurant near his house.
Tom won't likely forget to tell Mary about the party.
Tom won't likely be able to do everything by himself.
Tom will likely go to the zoo with Mary next weekend.
Tom will be very disappointed if he sees you do that.
Tom was found guilty of murder and sentenced to life.
Tom wants to know what time you're going to be there.
Tom wanted to know how much ice cream Mary had eaten.
Tom walks to work, but he usually takes the bus home.
Tom tried his best to make sure Mary had a good time.
Tom took one piece of pie and gave the other to Mary.
Tom told us his side of the story. Mary told us hers.
Tom spends most of his time practicing his saxophone.
Tom should've tried on the shirt before he bought it.
